greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array T(n,m) of super ballot numbers read along diagonals.
comment: First row is A000108. 2nd row is A007054. 3rd row and 4th column are essentially A007272.
1st column is A001700. 2nd column is essentially A000108. 3rd column is A007054.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows
E. Allen, I. Gheorghiciuc, A Weighted Interpretation for the Super Catalan Numbers, J. Int. Seq. 17 (2014) # 14.10.7, Table 1.
Ira M. Gessel, Super ballot numbers, J. Symb. Comput. vol 14, iss 2-3 (1992) pp 179-194.
example: Array with rows n>=0 and columns m>=0 starts
maple: for d from 0 to 12 do for c from 0 to d do printf("%d, ",T(d-c,c)) ; od: od:
mathematica: T[n_, m_] := (2*n+1)!/n!*(2*m)!/m!/(m+n+1)!; Table[T[n-m, m], {n, 0, 12}, {m, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2014, after Maple *)
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 23 2008
